Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of four (3 + 1) lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now smudged in parts, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.171)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36383) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36383)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 240 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
